title: Naive script similar to Australia tourism branding
content:
I came across this thread [http://www.typophile.com/node/43276](http://web.archive.org/web/20130328072401/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43276 "http://www.typophile.com/node/43276") and I love the font Pablo uses in one of his logo ideas in his second post, the logo on the right. It reminds me of the face used for Australia's tourism branding. I don't even know what search terms to use to find something like it.

Does anyone know what it is? Or one similar?

(In case the image doesn't display, you can see it here: [http://www.typophile.com/files/prueba%202\_5770.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130328072401/http:/www.typophile.com/files/prueba%202_5770.gif))

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [coolfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130328072401/http:/typophile.com/files/coolfont.jpg) | 3.36 KB |
author: mahnamahna

comments.content:
It reminds me of [Rouge](http://web.archive.org/web/20130328072401/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/rouge/) for some reason.

[Reliq Extra Active](http://web.archive.org/web/20130328072401/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/reliq-mm/extra-active/) has a similar flavour.

The closest I could think of was [Rats (w/alts)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130328072401/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Rats&x=15&y=9&sample_text=Conexion) from Font Bureau, but I think this is a 'personal' (custom) font design, of the kind we describe in our FAQ about hand-printed fonts. Easy and cheap to do.

- Mike Yanega
